newsitem.title: COSTA RICA: Costa Rica reopens 26,500 T optional rice tender.
newsitem.headline: Costa Rica reopens 26,500 T optional rice tender.

text.p: Costa Rica opened the tender on Thursday for an optional 26,500 tonnes of long grain rough rice or 18,000 tonnes long grain milled rice, Granos Basicos de Centroamerica said in a public announcement on Thursday.
Offers will be accepted through April 16, the company in charge of the tender for the industrial rice sector said.

The company postponed the buy tender of 30,000 tonnes of rice on March 24, saying the prices proposed by 16 bidders were too high. Executive director Alvaro Cordero said the minimum offer was $287.69 per tonne while local prices are about $271.00 per tonne.
In the last tender, U.S. and Argentinian companies participated, he said.
Costa Rica has forecast rice production at 185,000 tonnes this year compared to consumption levels at an anticipated 275,000 tonnes. The shortfall will be made up with imports.
